security_controls.verification_method: Network and configuration review showing separation and least-privilege telemetry ingestion mechanisms.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Strong authentication and authorization for API access (token-based, MFA, RBAC)

security_controls.requirement: Employ multifactor authentication for network access to privileged functions and ensure the use of tokens and authenticators.
security_controls.relevance: Directly requires MFA and token use for privileged access which strengthens API access controls as requested.
security_controls.integration_tips: Require MFA for administrative API operations and issue scoped tokens for programmatic access with limited lifetimes and rotation policies.
security_controls.verification_method: Review authentication configuration, MFA enrollment records and test privileged API access requires MFA or equivalent controls.

security_controls.requirement: Implement secure token handling, strong authentication including MFA, and protect session tokens in APIs.
security_controls.relevance: Specifies secure token/session handling and MFA guidance applicable to API authentication and protection of tokens.
security_controls.integration_tips: Use short-lived JWTs or opaque tokens with refresh flows, secure storage of tokens, and revoke tokens upon suspicious activity.
security_controls.verification_method: Token lifecycle review, token revocation tests, and security review of token storage mechanisms.

security_controls.requirement: Manage user access rights and ensure appropriate authentication mechanisms including multi-factor where required.
security_controls.relevance: Requires management of access rights and supports RBAC enforcement and MFA for API users.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement RBAC with least privilege, regular access reviews, and integrate MFA into identity providers used by the API.
security_controls.verification_method: Access reviews, RBAC policy audits and verification of MFA enforcement for targeted roles.

security_controls.requirement: Implement account management processes and RBAC to ensure authorized access to system resources.
security_controls.relevance: Mandates account management and RBAC which is central to fine-grained authorization for API access.
security_controls.integration_tips: Maintain automated provisioning/deprovisioning, role definitions, and least-privilege assignments for API consumer accounts.
security_controls.verification_method: Audit account lifecycle records and RBAC role assignments for appropriate least-privilege enforcement.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Fine-grained access control and multi-tenant isolation (per-customer isolation options)

security_controls.requirement: Employ application partitioning and isolation techniques to separate execution environments and reduce the impact of compromise.
security_controls.relevance: Directly supports per-customer isolation by mandating partitioning/isolation techniques to prevent tenant data/misuse crossover.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement tenant namespaces, separate storage buckets or strong logical isolation and enforce network segmentation between tenants.
security_controls.verification_method: Isolation testing that attempts cross-tenant access and review of partitioning configurations and policies.

security_controls.requirement: Restrict access to information and application functions; enforce separation of duties and tenant isolation as needed.
security_controls.relevance: Requires restriction of access and supports tenant isolation and per-customer segregation of duties and access.
security_controls.integration_tips: Design access control policies enforcing tenant scope, and include per-customer configuration options to enable dedicated tenancy where required.
security_controls.verification_method: Policy and configuration review showing tenant-scoped access controls and separation of duties assignments.

security_controls.requirement: Enforce per-request or per-tenant isolation using containers, sandboxes, or VMs and limit privileges of execution environments.
security_controls.relevance: Prescribes technical isolation mechanisms (containers/VMs) needed to provide per-customer isolation options.
security_controls.integration_tips: Offer deployment options ranging from logical isolation to dedicated VMs/instances and enforce privilege separation and network ACLs.
security_controls.verification_method: Validate tenant deployment options and perform security tests verifying isolation boundaries.

security_controls.requirement: Enforce access control policies that allow fine-grained authorization decisions for tenants and resources.
security_controls.relevance: Requires enforcement mechanisms to make fine-grained authorization decisions, enabling per-customer control over resources.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement policy decision/enforcement points supporting attribute-based or role-based access controls with tenant scoping.
security_controls.verification_method: Access enforcement testing with varied tenant roles and attributes to ensure correct authorization decisions.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: End-to-end encryption for data in transit and at rest, with customer-controlled keys where required

security_controls.section: Policy on the use of cryptographic controls
security_controls.requirement: Use cryptographic controls to protect the confidentiality, integrity and availability of information; support customer-managed keys where required.
security_controls.relevance: Mandates cryptographic controls and explicitly mentions supporting customer-managed keys, aligning with end-to-end encryption and CMEK requirements.
security_controls.integration_tips: Offer CMEK integration with KMS/HSM solutions, enforce TLS 1.2+/mTLS for transit and AES-GCM/modern ciphers for rest encryption with key separation per tenant.
security_controls.verification_method: Review encryption configurations, key access controls and evidence of CMEK usage and separation for tenants requesting it.

security_controls.requirement: Ensure strong transport layer protection (TLS) and encryption for data at rest with key management best practices.
security_controls.relevance: Specifies transport and storage encryption practices necessary to implement end-to-end protections.
security_controls.integration_tips: Enforce TLS with strong cipher suites, use server/client certificates, and ensure data-at-rest encryption integrates with secure key management.
security_controls.verification_method: TLS configuration scans, encryption-at-rest verification and review of key management integration and logs.

security_controls.requirement: Protect the integrity of information during processing and transmission to preserve original content.
security_controls.relevance: Supports cryptographic protections for integrity and confidentiality in transit/at rest, aligning with end-to-end encryption goals.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement authenticated encryption for stored data and integrity checks (MACs) for transmitted payloads; separate keys per tenant where feasible.
security_controls.verification_method: Cryptographic usage review, key separation validation and integrity verification tests.

security_controls.requirement: Control access to storage and media and protect media using encryption when required.
security_controls.relevance: Reinforces protecting stored media via encryption and controlling access which aligns with end-to-end confidentiality requirements.
security_controls.integration_tips: Apply disk/volume encryption supplemented by application-level encryption for sensitive payloads and restrict administrative access to keys.
security_controls.verification_method: Encryption evidence for storage volumes and access control reviews for media/key management.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Secure key management, secrets handling, and cryptographic lifecycle controls

security_controls.requirement: Establish a key management program that covers lifecycle including key generation, distribution, rotation, storage and destruction.
security_controls.relevance: Directly mandates a comprehensive key management program covering lifecycle stages essential to secure keys and secrets.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement centralized KMS/HSM, define key policies, automate rotation and retirement, and limit key access to authorized services and personnel.
security_controls.verification_method: Review KMS configurations, rotation logs, key access policies and evidence of controlled key destruction.

security_controls.requirement: Implement key management practices to protect cryptographic keys throughout their lifecycle.
security_controls.relevance: Requires institutionalization of key management practices that align with secure lifecycle management for secrets.
security_controls.integration_tips: Document key handling procedures, require HSM for high-value keys, and include keys in asset and change management processes.
security_controls.verification_method: Examine key management procedures and records of key lifecycle events and custody.

security_controls.requirement: Use secure key storage, rotate keys, use HSMs or KMS and prevent secrets leakage in applications and logs.
security_controls.relevance: Provides application-level guidance for preventing secrets leakage and using secure storage/KMS/HSM which is essential for secure secrets handling.
security_controls.integration_tips: Use environment-separated secret stores, avoid embedding secrets in code or logs, and enforce least-privilege access to secrets.
security_controls.verification_method: Secret scanning, code reviews for secret leaks, and inspection of KMS/HSM use and access controls.

security_controls.requirement: Enforce cryptographic key establishment and management processes to secure communications and stored data.
security_controls.relevance: Supports managed key establishment and distribution processes necessary for secrets lifecycle controls across systems.
security_controls.integration_tips: Design secure key exchange protocols, use authenticated channels for key distribution and integrate management workflows with organizational PKI.
security_controls.verification_method: Review key establishment protocols, PKI artifacts and evidence of secure distribution channels.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Comprehensive audit logging and immutable tamper-evident trails for requests, tasks, and outputs

security_controls.requirement: Generate audit records for defined events and ensure they contain sufficient information to establish what events occurred.
security_controls.relevance: Requires generation of audit records for events, essential for tracking requests, tasks and outputs to create traceable trails.
security_controls.integration_tips: Define the list of auditable events (task create/update/result, retrieval), capture actor, timestamp, and task identifiers, and ensure logs are immutable.
security_controls.verification_method: Audit log inspection verifying required fields are present and completeness of recorded events.

security_controls.requirement: Implement logging and monitoring of events and ensure logs are protected from tampering.
security_controls.relevance: Mandates protection of logs from tampering and implies controls to make trails tamper-evident and durable.
security_controls.integration_tips: Store logs in WORM or append-only storage with strict access controls and cryptographic integrity checks to detect tampering.
security_controls.verification_method: Review log storage configurations, integrity checks, and access controls; attempt tamper simulations where safe.

security_controls.requirement: Record and protect audit records for business-critical operations and provide tamper-evident storage for logs.
security_controls.relevance: Specifically requires recording and protecting audit records for business-critical events, matching need for immutable trails for requests/tasks/outputs.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement signed log entries, centralized secure logging pipelines, and role-based access to audit stores to ensure integrity and traceability.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect signed log entries, centralized log pipelines and role-based access policies; validate tamper-evidence features.

security_controls.requirement: Protect audit information from unauthorized access, modification, and deletion to ensure its integrity.
security_controls.relevance: Requires protecting audit data which supports producing immutable, tamper-evident trails for critical events.
security_controls.integration_tips: Apply encryption at rest, strict access controls and retention policies for audit data; implement monitoring for any audit data access.
security_controls.verification_method: Review access logs for audit repositories and confirm protections against modification/deletion are in place.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Data retention, deletion, and data subject rights (GDPR) support including deletion/export of originals and outputs

security_controls.section: Privacy and protection of personally identifiable information
security_controls.requirement: Ensure appropriate measures for privacy and protection of PII including rights to access, rectification and erasure.
security_controls.relevance: Directly covers GDPR-like data subject rights and requires measures for access/rectification/erasure of PII and related data assets.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement APIs and workflows to export and delete originals/outputs on request, document retention schedules and verify erasure from backups where feasible.
security_controls.verification_method: Review DSAR handling procedures, test deletion/export flows and evidence of correlated backup sanitization.

security_controls.requirement: Implement data retention, deletion and data subject rights support in application design including export and erasure.
security_controls.relevance: Specifically instructs implementing retention/deletion and DSAR support in application design aligned with GDPR needs.
security_controls.integration_tips: Provide per-customer retention policies, implement efficient deletion pipelines and ensure exported data formats preserve necessary metadata for portability.
security_controls.verification_method: DSAR acceptance tests, retention policy audits and verification of deletion across store tiers.

security_controls.requirement: Implement controls to manage media access, retention and sanitization including secure deletion.
security_controls.relevance: Addresses secure deletion and media sanitization processes needed to fulfill erasure obligations across storage and backups.
security_controls.integration_tips: Define secure deletion procedures, track data locations (including backups) and ensure processes include certification of destruction where required.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect deletion logs, backup retention management and evidence of secure sanitization actions.

security_controls.requirement: Document retention policies and procedures to support legal and privacy obligations.
security_controls.relevance: Requires documented retention policies which are necessary to govern GDPR-related retention and deletion behavior.
security_controls.integration_tips: Publish retention schedules, map data flows to retention rules and integrate DSAR processing into documented procedures.
security_controls.verification_method: Review published retention policies and alignment with implemented retention/deletion mechanisms.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Input validation, content sanitization, and protection against malicious files (malware scanning, safe parsing)

security_controls.requirement: Validate and safely parse uploaded files; preserve content structure where needed while preventing dangerous constructs.
security_controls.relevance: Directly relevant to validating/sanitizing inputs and securely parsing diverse file formats to prevent exploitation via malicious files.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement file-type validation, sanitize files (strip macros/active content), and parse in isolated sandboxes with strict resource constraints.
security_controls.verification_method: Run fuzzing and file-format attack tests and validate quarantine/alerting behavior on malicious samples.

security_controls.requirement: Employ mechanisms to detect and protect against malicious code and files including scanning and quarantine.
security_controls.relevance: Mandates malware scanning and quarantine processes which are core to protecting ingestion pipelines from malicious files.
security_controls.integration_tips: Integrate AV/malware scanning at ingestion points, maintain signatures and heuristic engines, and route suspect files to isolated sandboxes for analysis.
security_controls.verification_method: Review malware scanning configs, detection logs and quarantine handling; test with benign test malware samples (EICAR).

security_controls.requirement: Implement anti-malware controls and procedures for handling potentially malicious files.
security_controls.relevance: Requires organizational anti-malware measures and procedures complementing technical scanning to handle malicious files.
security_controls.integration_tips: Document malware handling playbooks, assign responsibilities for investigation and integrate AV outputs into incident workflows.
security_controls.verification_method: Operational evidence of malware incidents handling and periodic testing/audits of anti-malware coverage.

security_controls.requirement: Ensure third-party components handle input validation and parsing safely and are tested for malicious inputs.
security_controls.relevance: Requires vendors/components to be tested for safe parsing which is crucial when ingesting many document formats via third-party libraries.
security_controls.integration_tips: Require vendor security assessment evidence for parsers and include parser fuzzing in acceptance tests.
security_controls.verification_method: Review vendor assessment reports and parser test/fuzzing results.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Deterministic model behavior controls and testing for terminology fidelity and non-addition properties

security_controls.requirement: Apply automated testing to ensure business logic correctness and that outputs conform to specified behavior.
security_controls.relevance: Directly mandates automated testing for functional correctness which applies to verifying deterministic model outputs and fidelity constraints.
security_controls.integration_tips: Create test harnesses to run deterministic test suites against models for terminology fidelity and non-addition; include regression tests in CI/CD.
security_controls.verification_method: Review automated test results, CI/CD runs and acceptance criteria demonstrating deterministic outcomes and fidelity checks.

security_controls.requirement: Require vendors to test and demonstrate system behavior including functional correctness and deterministic outputs.
security_controls.relevance: Mandates vendor-provided testing evidence that the model behaves deterministically where required and meets fidelity constraints.
security_controls.integration_tips: Include deterministic behavior and fidelity tests in vendor SLAs and acceptance tests; require reproducibility artifacts and model versioning.
security_controls.verification_method: Examine vendor test artifacts and reproduce tests locally to confirm deterministic behaviors.

security_controls.requirement: Ensure that development processes include verification and testing of functional requirements including fidelity requirements.
security_controls.relevance: Requires verification/testing in development processes and applies to ensuring models meet fidelity and non-addition functional requirements.
security_controls.integration_tips: Incorporate fidelity test cases into development sprints and require acceptance sign-off for model behavior changes impacting terminology preservation.
security_controls.verification_method: Review development artifacts and test results demonstrating verification of fidelity requirements.

security_controls.requirement: Perform security assessments including functional testing to validate system behavior meets security and functional requirements.
security_controls.relevance: Mandates independent security assessments which can validate deterministic behaviors and non-addition guarantees as part of system assurance.
security_controls.integration_tips: Engage independent assessors to validate deterministic behavior and fidelity in realistic scenarios and include findings in remediation plans.
security_controls.verification_method: Assessment reports and evidence of remediation for any behavioral divergences found during security assessments.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Vendor/third-party integration controls and supply chain security (model providers, storage, telemetry)

security_controls.requirement: Identify and manage supply chain risks and ensure acquired components meet security requirements.
security_controls.relevance: Directly mandates supply chain risk management for third-party model providers, storage and telemetry services used by the system.
security_controls.integration_tips: Perform vendor risk assessments, require security attestations and contractually enforce security requirements and SLAs for providers.
security_controls.verification_method: Vendor risk assessment records, contract clauses and evidence of periodic reassessments and attestations.

security_controls.requirement: Establish controls to manage supplier relationships and ensure security requirements are met.
security_controls.relevance: Requires supplier relationship controls ensuring that vendor integrations for models/storage/telemetry satisfy security requirements.
security_controls.integration_tips: Include security requirements in supplier contracts, perform onboarding security checks and require incident notification commitments.
security_controls.verification_method: Contract reviews, supplier audits and evidence of compliance with onboarding security checks.

security_controls.requirement: Vet third-party components and providers for security posture and ensure secure integration.
security_controls.relevance: Specifies vetting of third-party components which applies to model providers and telemetry/storage integrations.
security_controls.integration_tips: Maintain an approved components list, perform SBOM/attestation checks and require secure integration templates (network, auth, telemetry) for suppliers.
security_controls.verification_method: Review SBOMs, vendor security questionnaires and integration checklists showing secure configurations.

security_controls.requirement: Implement enterprise supply chain risk management processes to monitor and control third-party risk.
security_controls.relevance: Mandates an enterprise approach to supply chain risk which strengthens vendor governance for model and storage integrations.
security_controls.integration_tips: Integrate supply chain risk tools, monitor vendor security metrics and escalate supply chain incidents through an established governance process.
security_controls.verification_method: Supply chain risk program documentation, monitoring dashboards and incident handling evidence for vendor-related issues.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Incident response, backup & recovery, and disaster recovery plans for confidentiality and availability

security_controls.requirement: Establish incident handling capabilities including preparation, detection, analysis, containment, eradication and recovery.
security_controls.relevance: Directly requires incident handling capabilities necessary to respond to incidents impacting confidentiality and availability of translation services.
security_controls.integration_tips: Develop IR playbooks for data leakage, model compromise and availability incidents; run tabletop and live exercises to validate readiness.
security_controls.verification_method: IR plan review, exercise reports and evidence of incident detection and response activities.

security_controls.chapter: Information security aspects of business continuity management
security_controls.requirement: Implement information security continuity measures aligned with business continuity management to ensure availability and confidentiality.
security_controls.relevance: Mandates continuity measures ensuring information security during disruptions, covering backup and disaster recovery for availability/confidentiality.
security_controls.integration_tips: Integrate information security into BCP/DR plans, perform backup validation, and ensure encrypted backups with controlled access and recovery testing.
security_controls.verification_method: BCP/DR test reports, backup restore tests and evidence of security controls during recovery procedures.

security_controls.requirement: Develop and maintain contingency plans to ensure continued operations and availability under disruptions, including performance degradation.
security_controls.relevance: Requires contingency planning to preserve availability and recovery capabilities which directly applies to backup & DR requirements.
security_controls.integration_tips: Maintain and test contingency plans, include data confidentiality measures during recovery and document escalation and recovery RTO/RPO targets.
security_controls.verification_method: Contingency plan evidence and results of DR exercises demonstrating recovery within RTO/RPO.

security_controls.requirement: Implement backup and recovery procedures and plan for resilient deployments to preserve confidentiality and availability.
security_controls.relevance: Prescribes resilience and recovery practices for hosts/containers relevant to maintaining confidentiality and availability of translation services.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement automated backups, test restore processes for containers/hosts, and ensure backups are encrypted and access-controlled.
security_controls.verification_method: Backup/restore test records and resilience test results for containerized deployments.

cross_functional_controls.description: Centralized, tamper-evident logging and audit trails covering auth, task lifecycle events, system changes and admin actions.
applies_to: All requirements (especially R2, R9, R17, R18, R20)
cross_functional_controls.implementation_guidance: Use append-only or WORM storage for audit logs, cryptographically sign critical entries, restrict access by RBAC, and integrate logs with SIEM for alerting and retention policies matching compliance needs.

cross_functional_controls.description: End-to-end encryption for data in transit and at rest, and a governed key management program supporting customer-controlled keys.
cross_functional_controls.implementation_guidance: Adopt TLS/mTLS for transport, authenticated encryption for storage, centralized KMS/HSM for keys, enforce rotation and least-privilege access and provide CMEK options where requested.

cross_functional_controls.description: Strong authentication (MFA), token management, RBAC and tenant-scoped authorization enforced across APIs and management planes.
cross_functional_controls.implementation_guidance: Integrate with enterprise IdP for MFA and RBAC, issue short-lived scoped tokens for APIs, enforce attribute-based access control for tenant scoping and perform periodic access reviews.

cross_functional_controls.description: Collect operational telemetry (throughput, latency, error rates, resource usage) without capturing content or PII.
cross_functional_controls.implementation_guidance: Instrument metadata-only metrics, mask/anonymize identifiers, separate telemetry channels from data channels and enforce retention and access controls for observability data.

cross_functional_controls.description: Secure SDLC processes including input validation, fuzzing, deterministic behavior testing and vendor/component vetting.
cross_functional_controls.implementation_guidance: Include format parsers in security testing (fuzzing), require vendor security evidence, include deterministic and fidelity tests in CI/CD and gate releases on security test results.
